vidis.data.mod
Interface IUserComponent

All Known Subinterfaces:
IUserLink, IUserNode, IUserPacket
All Known Implementing Classes:
ADemoPacket, AUserComponent, AUserLink, AUserNode, AUserPacket, BullyElectionAlgorithmNode, DefaultLink, DefaultLink, DefaultLink, DemoLink, DemoNode, DemoPingPacket, DemoPongPacket, ElectionPacket, ElectionWinPacket, FloodNode, FloodPacket, VarTestNode, VectorClockAlgorithmNode, VectorClockAlgorithmPacket
public interface IUserComponent

basic module component interface that all user implemented modules must implement

Author:
Dominik

Method Summary
 void execute()
          this function is executed on each simulation step NOTE: it is impossible to tell which of the components executes first!
 AVariable getVariable(String identifier)
          This function can be used to retrieve a user-scope set variable from the Simulator.
 boolean hasVariable(String identifier)
          checks if a variable exists in the user-scope
 void interrupt()
          interrupt a sleep of this component if component does not sleep, no action is made
 void sleep(int steps)
          let this user component sleep for some time
 

Method Detail

getVariable

AVariable getVariable(String identifier)
                      throws NullPointerException,
                             ClassCastException
This function can be used to retrieve a user-scope set variable from the Simulator. If you specified a variable in the .msim configuration file you will retrieve it here as a String

Type Parameters:
T - generic return type
Parameters:
clazz - the expected return class-type
identifier - the identifier of the requested variable
Returns:
null or object
Throws:
NullPointerException - thrown if not variable found
ClassCastException - thrown if expected type (clazz) does not match the variable class type

hasVariable

boolean hasVariable(String identifier)
checks if a variable exists in the user-scope

Parameters:
identifier - the identifier of the variable
Returns:
true or false

execute

void execute()
this function is executed on each simulation step NOTE: it is impossible to tell which of the components executes first! NOTE2: do NOT use Thread.sleep() or something like that - it will only hang the simulator NOTE3: use built-in sleep() and interrupt() functions!

sleep

void sleep(int steps)
let this user component sleep for some time

Parameters:
steps - simulator steps to sleep

interrupt

void interrupt()
interrupt a sleep of this component if component does not sleep, no action is made
